result.execSummary:
The defendant Willliam D Beiersdorf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willliam D Beiersdorf in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for  3 days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for one year with the following conditions:
*referred to mental health unit 
*take all prescribed medications
*60 days condition time, no huber privileges stayed until 12-26-15
*no ownership of weapons
*surrender CCW permit to the department of justice
*complete sobriety
*pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Willliam D Beiersdorf in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willliam D Beiersdorf in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-15-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willliam D Beiersdorf in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 47.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willliam D Beiersdorf in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 08-05-2015 at 08:30 am.

  Court ordered case adjourned for continued pretrial conference in Branch 47. lr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-14-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willliam D Beiersdorf in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Alyssa M. Schaller with student appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for CONTINUED  pretrial conference in Branch  47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-21-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Willliam D Beiersdorf
Current: 1820 West Wells, Milwaukee, WI 53233   (Effective: 03-12-2015)
Prior: 5568 South Nicholson Avenue, Cudahy, WI 53110

No dangerous weapons

Defendant Willliam D Beiersdorf in court.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-049

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  
Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  The case is adjourned to Branch 47 for a Pretrial Conference.
